newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan ends slightly down vs US dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan ends slightly down vs US dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed down slightly at 8.2932 on Tuesday from Monday's 8.2929 against the U.S. dollar due to a technical correction, traders said.
The weighted average price on Monday was 8.2930.
Dealers said the correction had been expected after the yuan's steady rise over the past week with the rate now around a three-month high level.

The yuan opened little unchanged at 8.2930 and moved around the opening level for most of the session, hitting an intraday high of 8.2926 and a low of 8.2936. Trading was dull with most business done at 8.2929, traders said.
One dealer said that while the yuan's upward momentum was weakening, pro-yuan sentiment remained strong.
A second dealer said the central bank seemed to have done little to depress the local currency over recent sessions.
"In the absense of central bank intervention, the yuan's upward trend is expected to continue after a short-lived correction," he said.
Dealers said they expected the yuan to move around the 8.2930 level on Wednesday.
The yuan ended up at 6.9300 from 6.9854 against 100 Japanese yen and unchanged at 1.0717 against the Hong Kong dollar.
